entry.title: Turkey Intensifies Crypto Regulations In Bid to Exit FATFâ€™s Grey List
entry.summary:
In a strategic move to strengthen its financial regulations, Turkey is set to introduce stringent laws governing crypto-assets.
This decision is part of a broader effort to address the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) concerns and secure removal from its â€˜grey listâ€™ of nations with â€œinadequateâ€ measures against money laundering and terrorist financing.
Finance Minister Announces New Legislation On Crypto Assets
According to a report from Reuters, the FATF, established by the G7 to safeguard the integrity of the global financial system, placed Turkey on this watchlist in 2021. The country has since worked diligently to align its policies with international standards.
Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek, in a recent parliamentary commission meeting, disclosed that Turkey has successfuâ€¦

Stan Druckenmiller Says He Should Own Bitcoin
Billionaire investor Stanley Druckenmiller discussed bitcoin investing with fellow hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones during a fireside chat at the JPMorgan/Robin Hood Investors Conference in New York City on Oct. 24. Druckenmiller is the chairman and CEO of Duquesne Family Office LLC. He was previously a managing director at Soros Fund Management where he had overall responsibility for funds with a peak asset value of $22 billion. According to Forbesâ€™ lâ€¦

entry.summary:
Taiwanâ€™s police have recently dismantled a substantial crypto-related money laundering scheme. In Taichung, authorities discovered and arrested individuals in a criminal operation involving roughly 324.2 million USDT (Tether).
The latest report shows the case marks the largest of its kind in Taiwanâ€™s history, shedding light on the dark underbelly of digital currency exploitation for illegal purposes.
The Intricacies Of The Crypto Laundering Operation
The bust stems from an extensive investigation initiated in June, which tied the money laundering activities to an investment fraud case examined in October 2022, according to the report.
The work of the police criminal investigation bureau led to the apprehension of a suspect with the family name Chiu, who is alleged to have playeâ€¦

entry.title: Coinbase Launches Leveraged Crypto Futures for US Traders With Nano-Sized BTC and ETH Contracts
entry.summary:
Coinbase Financial Markets (CFM) introduced regulated leveraged crypto futures for its U.S. customers Wednesday, now available to Coinbase Advanced users. The trading platform currently offers nano-sized contracts at one-hundredth of a bitcoin and one-tenth of an ethereum.
Coinbase Financial Markets Rolls Out Crypto Futures for U.S. Investors
The San Francisco-based crypto platform, Coinbase, is beginning to gradually introduce its bitcoin and ethereum futures offerings. CFMâ€™s goal is to â€œmake futures more accessible to retail crypto traders,â€ according to the announcement Wednesday. With the launch, Coinbase Advanced customers in the U.S. can now access the regulated crypto futures contracts
Coinbase explains that futures derivatives products allow traders to hedge risk and diversify. â€œLeverage in futures trading can work for you or against you. The risk of loss using leverage can exceed your initial investment amount,â€ the announcement discloses.
The exchange added:
These futures contracts are specifically sized for retail traders, at 1/100th of a bitcoin and 1/10th of an ethereum.
The company further explained that CFMâ€™s approval to offer federally regulated crypto futures trading in August marked a critical milestone, signaling significant progress in the crypto trading domain. Coinbase also noted the pivotal role of education in CFMâ€™s strategy, providing a suite of articles for traders covering a range of topics, from the basics of futures trading to the associated benefits and risks.
The firmâ€™s stock (Nasdaq: COIN) is up 0.48% for the month and 58% over the past six months. Year-to-date, COIN has gained 111% against the U.S. dollar. Customers not using Coinbase Advanced can apply to trade futures with CFM, provided they pass the anti-money laundering/know-your-customer (AML/KYC) and verification processes.
What do you think about Coinbase introducing its futures crypto products to U.S. traders? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: SafeMoon Executives Hit with SEC Charges for Alleged "Massive Fraudulent Scheme"
entry.summary: The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has charged SafeMoon, its Founder Kyle Nagy, SafeMoon US, and the company's top executives, John Karony and Thomas Smith. The regulator has revealed a fraudulent scheme involving the unregistered sale of SafeMoon tokens (SFM), a cryptocurrency that promised investors huge returns. The SEC is accusing the crypto project's executives of a fraudulent scheme that misled investors by assuring the safety of their funds while, in reality, large portions of the liquidity pool were never locked. This resulted in misappropriation of funds exceeding $200 million for personal use. David Hirsch, the Chief of the SEC Enforcement Division's Crypto Assets and Cyber Unit, stated: â€œDecentralized finance claims to deliver transparency and predictaâ€¦

entry.title: FTXâ€™s Sam Bankman-Fried Completes His Testimony, Hereâ€™s What To Expect Next
entry.summary:
Sam Bankman-Fried has concluded his last testimony in his criminal trial and now the fate of the former FTX CEO lies in the hands of Jurors with the power to convict him to his sentence or exonerate him.Â
Former FTX CEO Testimony Reaches Climax
Founder and former CEO of failed FTX Trading Ltd, Sam Bankman-Fried has been on trial after being accused of seven counts of fraud and conspiracy charges related to the collapse of the now-bankrupt crypto exchange.Â
The former CEO has constantly pleaded not guilty on all charges and took the stand for the first time last Friday to personally defend his case on the fraud trial.Â
Tuesday marked the Bankman-Friedâ€™s last day of testimony in a court trial headed by Judge Lewis A. Kaplan and the FTX founder was seen to be struggling with the barâ€¦

entry.title: Gimme Shelter: Withdrawing From The Music Industry
entry.summary: This article is featured in Bitcoin Magazineâ€™s â€œThe Withdrawal Issueâ€. Click here to subscribe now. A PDF pamphlet of this article is available for download. Music Industry Misfortune The music industry is notorious for preying on the artists on which its existence depends. In the early days of recorded music, this exploitation started with unfavorable contracts, depriving musicians of the fruits of their labor while record labels made all the money. The mistreatment has since evolved into the Live Nation Entertainment monopoly, where the company has a nearly exclusive hold on the ticket market (thanks, Ticketmaster!) and an equally tight grasp on the event side, where the company owned at least 259 venues worldwide as of 2021, and where many of their ticketed concerts are held. Ticketmastâ€¦

entry.title: US Senator Ted Cruz Now Accepts Bitcoin For Campaign Donations
entry.summary:
US senator Ted Cruz has officially begun accepting Bitcoin for his senate campaign donations, according to his officialÂ website, withÂ Bitcoin paymentsÂ firm OpenNode facilitating the transactions. Payments to the campaign can either be made on-chain or via lightning network transactions.
Bitcoin Campaign Donations Accepted Ted Cruz for Senate
Cruz has been a very vocal proponent of Bitcoin in the senate over the last few years, especially when it comes to the energy front, where he says the Bitcoin industry "is generating enormous benefits for Texas, for the country."Â The senator seemingly wants to help lead a charge on educating and bringing more Bitcoin awareness to his colleges in office, alerting that he has "real concern when it comes to congress," because he serves "in the U.S. senate, a body where I'm not sure we have 5 senators that can tell you what the hell a Bitcoin is." This past April, the sitting senator attempted to bring more BTC awareness to DC as he featured in a fireside chat at the Bitcoin Policy Summit, revealingÂ that he owns "a little more than 2 bitcoin, and every Monday I own a little bit more...I am incrediblyÂ bullish on Bitcoin specifically."
Cruz joins a growing list of US politicians starting to accept Bitcoin for campaign donations in 2023. Earlier this year, presidential candidates Robert F. Kennedy Jr andÂ Vivek Ramaswamy both starting accepting BTC also through OpenNode for campaign donations.

Bitcoin Is Perceived â€œSafe Assetâ€
El-Erian stated, â€œThere have been two big puzzles. They show how unsettling the volatility in the US Treasuries have been. One is, you havenâ€™t had it been the safe haven. We havenâ€™t seen the flight to quality, and the flight to safety you would expect, given what is happening in the world.â€

entry.title: Bitcoin Network Shatters Records With Hashrate Climbing to 464 EH/s
entry.summary:
While the price of Bitcoin has found stability, and the networkâ€™s difficulty remains fixed at 62.46 trillion until November 12, 2023, a different story unfolds in the hashrate department. Here, the seven-day average showcases a record-breaking moment for the network on November 1. On Wednesday, Bitcoin achieved an unprecedented 464 exahash per second (EH/s), marking another significant milestone in its history.
Bitcoin Miners Demonstrate Strength Amid Sky-High Difficulty
The hashrate of Bitcoin maintains its upward momentum, and as of November 1, 2023, it has reached a new peak. According to the seven-day simple moving average (SMA), the networkâ€™s hashrate touched 464 EH/s for the first time. Delving deeper, the three-day SMA unveils that the total hashrate of the network soared even hâ€¦

entry.title: 'A Grand Experiment': Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury Talks Game Economics
entry.summary: How much of Shrapnel's in-game items are tradeable NFTs? Don Norbury, Studio Head at Shrapnel and CTO at game studio NEON, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Shrapnel's approach to game economics, including different game pricing models and how NFT game economies create different challenges for developers.

entry.title: Trezor Safe 3 and Trezor Keep Metal Unboxing
entry.summary: Trezor has launched the Safe 3, a hardware wallet aimed at "new entrants to crypto," alongside the new Keep Metal recovery seed storage device. We take a first look at what comes in the box.

entry.title: Why AI Arena is Building on Arbitrum
entry.summary: AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie discuss the challenges that come with building on Ethereum, ETH sidechains, and layer-two blockchains.

entry.title: Pet3rPan_ on venture DAOs and blockchain games
entry.summary:
Welcome to the 4th episode of this time will be different.
Our guest for today's episode is Pet3rpan_ from Metacartel, 1kx, HydraVentures, and more!
https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_
This Time Will Be Different is sponsored by 1000x https://decrypt.co/1000x

entry.title: Inside Shrapnel's Marketplace, New Map, and 'AI Director' Feature
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Shrapnel's Head of Studio Don Norbury to get the latest updates on how the NFT-powered first-person sci-fi extraction shooter's development is progressing.

entry.title: 'Art of the Times': Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon on the State of Generative Art
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder and CEO Erick Calderon sat down with Sander Lutz, lead culture reporter at Decrypt's SCENE, at Art Blocks Marfa Weekend 2023. They discuss the evolution of the company and the generative art world, along with what draws art enthusiasts to be an active part of the community.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: Digital Ownership Explained
entry.summary: One of the most powerful aspects of blockchain technology is its ability to provide us genuine ownership of our digital assets. This is called digital ownership. In this video, weâ€™ll deep dive into digital ownership, why it matters, and how web3 makes owning digital assets like our social networks, music libraries, personal data, and beyond possible. Author: Clarissa Watson, Senior Writer at Consensys.
